Class Connect4ComputerPlayer

java.lang.Object
core.Connect4ComputerPlayer
public class Connect4ComputerPlayer extends Object
Displays in console a simulated game board for the game Connect 4.
See Also:
  • Connect4Logic
  • Connect4TextConsole

  • Constructor Details

    • Connect4ComputerPlayer

      public Connect4ComputerPlayer()
      Creates a new Connect4ComputerPlayer game object

  • Method Details

    • takeTurn

      public void takeTurn(GameState gameState)
      Takes a Player object and takes a turn. The computer will find an advantageous valid position to drop a token into and make the move. It will update the validMoveIndex and totalMoves.
      Parameters:
      gameState - the game state

    • computerMove

      public int computerMove(GameState gameState)
      Chooses a valid input from the validMoveIndex[] and tests to see which move is most advantageous by maximizing the connections between its tokens. It then checks to see if it needs to block the other player from winning. In future implementations the offense/defense on will be optimized to block the other player from getting three in a row. It will simulate a move it has made and one move the other person has made.
      Parameters:
      gameState - the game state
      Returns:
      the column to drop the token down.

    • countConnections

      public int countConnections(int row, int col, char marking, GameState gameState)
      Takes a row, column, and a marking. It will scan vertically, horizontally, and diagonally. With the local variable maxConnection it uses a Math.max to weigh it against the return value of countDirection. This adds up how many connections are possible in all directions. It subtracts one since the target being tested is double counted.
      Parameters:
      row - int of the row of the gameboardmatrix
      col - int of the col of the gameboardmatrix
      marking - of the player
      gameState - the game state
      Returns:
      the total connections to determine which move is most advantageous

    • countDirection

      public int countDirection(int row, int col, int rowDelta, int colDelta, char marking, GameState gameState)
      This takes a row, column. This is the targeted, valid potential move. It then adds up the total it would connect in all directions using the deltas to search up, down, side to side, and diagonally. It checks to make sure all parameters and changes are within the bounds of the matrix. It then returns the total.
      Parameters:
      row - integer of the row
      col - integer of the Column
      rowDelta - integer of the delta of the row/the direction the row extends
      colDelta - integer of the delta of the col/the direction the col extends
      marking - player char for marking
      gameState - the game state
      Returns:
      integer of the amount connected from a specific direction
